intro: Trichodia vareciformis, commonly known as the variable trichodia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves that often exhibit a variegated appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to certain regions of Africa and thrives in moist, tropical environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
